meanings.definition: The system or practice of being a landlord.
meanings.sent1: Landlordism involves owning and renting out properties.
meanings.sent2: In the city, landlordism is common due to high demand for housing.
meanings.sent3: The landlordism in this town is so strict, they even regulate the color of curtains.
meanings.sent4: His landlordism was like a spider weaving a web of rental agreements.
meanings.sent5: The landlordism in the neighborhood was as noticeable as the bright red doors on every house.

meanings.definition: The actions or behavior of a landlord.
meanings.sent1: Good landlordism includes timely repairs and respectful communication.
meanings.sent2: Her landlordism towards tenants was always fair and considerate.
meanings.sent3: The landlordism of the grumpy old man next door is legendary among the residents.
meanings.sent4: His strict landlordism was like a strict teacher in a classroom.
meanings.sent5: The landlordism of the building manager was as comforting as a warm blanket on a cold night.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a landlord.
meanings.sent1: After inheriting the properties, she found herself in the world of landlordism.
meanings.sent2: His successful landlordism allowed him to invest in more real estate.
meanings.sent3: The landlordism of the family business has been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the world of landlordism like a captain steering a ship through rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The landlordism of the wealthy businessman was as vast as the open sea, with properties stretching far and wide.
